level.heading: INFORMATION FROM DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AGENCIES (ยง 9-312)

level.text: Within five (5) days from the date of the filing of a deed recordation tax return, the Recorder of Deeds shall transmit the return to the Office of Tax and Revenue.

The Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs shall forward to the Office of Tax and Revenue a copy of each building permit relating to structural, electrical, or plumbing changes within five (5) days from the date the permit is approved.
The Zoning Commission shall provide to the Office of Tax and Revenue a detailed listing of each zoning and land use change within ten (10) days from the date of adoption of the change.
The Board of Zoning Adjustment shall submit to the Office of Tax and Revenue each approved zoning variance within fifteen (15) days from the date of the adoption of the variance.

The Office of the Surveyor shall provide to the Office of Tax and Revenue copies of each plat recorded in the subdivision books, each plat recorded in connection with condominiums, and a copy of each other plat recorded with respect to record lots within ten (10) days after the plat is recorded with the Office of the Surveyor.

The Fire Marshal of the Department of Fire and Emergency Medical Services shall, on or before the tenth (10th) day of each month, provide the Office of Tax and Revenue with a listing of each real property in the District which has been damaged or destroyed by fire.
The Deputy Chief Financial Officer, upon request, may extend the time for the filing of any documents required by this section to be filed with the Office of Tax and Revenue.
